meanings.definition: To fasten or attach with a knot or hook.
meanings.sent1: He hitched the rope to the tree.
meanings.sent2: She always hitched her dog's leash to the fence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hitched a ride on the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His success was hitched to his determination like a wagon to a horse.
meanings.sent5: The idea of teamwork was hitched to the project from the start.

meanings.sent1: They hitched in a beautiful ceremony.

meanings.sent3: The two lovebirds decided to hitch after a whirlwind romance.
meanings.sent4: Their fates were hitched together like two trains on the same track.
meanings.sent5: The idea of forever was hitched to their hearts as they said 'I do.'

meanings.definition: To move something by pulling it with a rope or chain.
meanings.sent1: He hitched the heavy load across the field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer hitched the plow to the tractor.
meanings.sent3: The determined ant hitched the leaf back to its colony.
meanings.sent4: The tugboat hitched the ship safely into the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The idea of progress was hitched to the hard work of the team.
